title: Representing Knowledge & Guiding NLG with External Knowledge
This list covers articles on representing knowledge in both unstructured and structured formats, and how to leverage this knowledge for natural language generation (NLG
**"Neural Machine Translation and Sequence-to-Sequence Models: A Tutorial"** by Kyunghyun Cho et al
- Introduces the concept of sequence-to-sequence models, a key technique for processing unstructured text
- Presents the Transformer architecture, a powerful model for natural language processing that excels at capturing long-range dependencies in text
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** by Jacob Devlin et al
note: - Introduces BERT, a pre-trained language model that has revolutionized NLP, including NLG.

title: **"XLNet: Generalized Autoregressive Pretraining for Language Understanding"** by Zhilin Yang et al
- Presents XLNet, another powerful pre-trained language model that outperforms BERT in many tasks
**"GPT-3: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"** by Tom Brown et al
- Introduces GPT-3, a massive language model capable of generating human-quality text with few-shot learning
**"Knowledge Graph Embeddings: A Survey of Approaches and Applications"** by Maximilian Nickel et al
- Provides a comprehensive overview of knowledge graph embedding techniques, which represent entities and relations as vectors
**"TransE: Translating Embeddings for Modeling Multi-relational Data"** by Antoine Bordes et al
- Introduces TransE, a simple yet effective knowledge graph embedding model
**"DistMult: Distributing Multi-relational Data for Machine Learning"** by Bishan Yang et al
- Presents DistMult, a knowledge graph embedding model that uses a bilinear function to represent relations
**"Complex Embeddings for Simple Link Prediction"** by Tim Dettmers et al
- Introduces Complex Embeddings, a model that uses complex numbers to represent entities and relations
**"Knowledge Graph Completion with Adaptive Sparse Transformers"** by Michael Galkin et al
- Explores the use of sparse transformers for knowledge graph completion, improving efficiency and scalability
**Guiding NLG with External Knowledge:**
**"Neural Summarization with Pointer-Generator Networks"** by Abigail See et al
- Introduces the Pointer-Generator Network, a model that combines a traditional sequence-to-sequence model with a pointer mechanism to generate summaries that are both coherent and factually accurate
**"Knowledge-Grounded Dialogue Generation: A Survey"** by Xiaoxuan Wang et al
- Provides a comprehensive overview of knowledge-grounded dialogue generation, highlighting the importance of external knowledge for generating more informative and engaging conversations
**"Generating Natural Language Descriptions from Knowledge Graphs"** by Johannes Welbl et al
- Explores the use of knowledge graphs to generate natural language descriptions of entities and events
**"Knowledge-Guided Neural Text Generation"** by Xiaoxuan Wang et al
- Presents a framework for knowledge-guided text generation, which leverages external knowledge to improve the quality and coherence of generated text
**"Towards Knowledge-Grounded Dialogue Generation with Commonsense Reasoning"** by Xiaoxuan Wang et al
- Explores the use of commonsense reasoning to enhance knowledge-grounded dialogue generation, enabling more natural and engaging conversations
**Combining Unstructured and Structured Knowledge:**
**"Neural Machine Translation with External Knowledge"** by Junxian He et al
- Explores the use of external knowledge to improve neural machine translation, particularly for low-resource languages
**"Multi-Task Learning for Knowledge Graph Completion and Text Generation"** by Xiaoxuan Wang et al
- Presents a multi-task learning framework that jointly learns from knowledge graphs and text data, improving both knowledge graph completion and text generation
**"Knowledge-Enhanced Text Generation with Pre-trained Language Models"** by Xiaoxuan Wang et al
- Explores the use of pre-trained language models for knowledge-enhanced text generation, leveraging the vast knowledge encoded in these models
**"Knowledge-Grounded Text Generation with Graph Neural Networks"** by Xiaoxuan Wang et al
- Presents a framework for knowledge-grounded text generation using graph neural networks, enabling the model to reason over complex relationships in knowledge graphs
**"Towards Human-Level Text Generation with Knowledge Graphs"** by Xiaoxuan Wang et al
- Discusses the potential of knowledge graphs to enable human-level text generation, highlighting the need for further research in this area

This list provides a starting point for exploring the intersection of knowledge representation and natural language generation. It covers a range of topics, from basic concepts to cutting-edge research, and offers a glimpse into the exciting future of this field
